alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:43PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Jefferson County through 515 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ozawkie, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valley Falls and Ozawkie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
